resources.string: Tap on the questions you want answered
How accurately do I need to measure?
The App itself is accurate to one imperial foot. You can use the app to get the measurement sufficiently close to then be able to align the tent according to the manufacturers instructions.
What if my measurement goes off the screen?
If the tether intersection point is visible, you can drag it to move all the anchors simultaneously. You can also change the units using the measurement scale feature.
Do I need to know how thick the tree is?

You do not need to know where the center of the tree is. Instead, imagine a knot on the surface of each tree about where the tent tether would attach, and measure the distance from the imaginary knot on one tree to the imaginary knot on the next anchoring tree, etc.
You are measuring the distances between (approximate locations of the) knots.
Why is my tent not in the list?

Try dragging the list with your finger to view tents that are not in view. Otherwise, if it is a newer product, we may need to add it. In that case try using a tent or hammock with a similar \"footprint\" as yours.

It helps to have a measuring tool handy, such as measuring tape or laser measuring tool. But, you could perform the measurements using consistently-spaced units, such as equally-spaced knots in a string, sufficiently consistent paces, or even the straps that come with the tent. The point here is to measure using consistent units.
What does the orange triangle indicate?

The orange triangle indicates that setup is possible, but involves a non-intuitive \"trick\". After wrapping the strap around the tree, (as you usually do), pass the ratchet (rather than the loose end of the strap) through the strap loop, and then use the ratchet to tighten the strap.
What does the yellow triangle indicate?
The yellow triangle indicates that you will probably not have sufficient strap length to wrap around the tree according to the manufacturers recommendations. Setup requires a strap extension.
What does the red X indicate?
The red X indicates that (ideal) setup is not possible. The tree with the red X over it is too close.
